thread.title: Latin Routes gets in the groove to celebrate high street move
thread.title_full: Latin Routes gets in the groove to celebrate high street move

title: Latin Routes gets in the groove to celebrate high street move
text:
Latin Routes gets in the groove to celebrate high street move 19 August 2015 Save 
Fast-growing tour operator Latin Routes is celebrating after opening its first high street store. 
The company, which recently brought in industry veteran John McEwan as chairman, decided to look for a new place after outgrowing its previous premises. 
“We have clients come to see us, so we have put in a boardroom now so we can provide on-site training, as well as see clients in the store, as we have a dedicated shop desk,” said Martin Johnson, director and co-founder at the company. 
He added that the company had enjoyed a successful year, having taken on some outside investment and increased staff numbers, with plans to have a total of six employees by September. 
“We’re also in the process of relaunching our website. The new platform’s going to allow us to create a whole new agent area,” he added. 
To celebrate the move, Latin Routes held a party for industry partners, including both suppliers and agents. 
Both directors of Latin Routes are former members of TTG’s Tomorrow’s Travel Leaders. Readers' comments (1) Rebecca Maffeis | Wed, 19 Aug 2015 12:15 pm 
Congratulations Latin Routes!
